question.title: Hibernate SQL Query result Mapping/Convert TO Object/Class/Bean

elements.contents: String sql = "select t_student.* from t_student"; //String sql = "select t_student.id,t_student.name,... from t_student"; //select all column SQLQuery query = session.createSQLQuery(sql); query.addEntity(Student.class);//or query.addEntity("alias", Student.class); //query.list();[Student@..., Student@..., Student@...] query.setResultTransformer(Transformers.ALIAS_TO_ENTITY_MAP); //or other transformer query.list(); //[{Student(or alias)=Student@...},{Student=Student@...}]

node.contents: Thank you. Use query.setResultTransformer({custom transformer}) after addScalar, can convert to Student.class,but I don't want it this way.

node.contents: I want it be a Object instance of Student, is there anyone know?

node.contents: You can use 1st or 2nd snippet. According to Hibernate documentation you must prefer 2nd.

astNode.text: You can use 1st or 2nd snippet. According to Hibernate documentation you must prefer 2nd.

node.contents: You can get just a list of object arrays, like this:

astNode.text: You can get just a list of object arrays, like this:

elements.contents: String sql = "select name, sex from t_student"; SQLQuery query = session.createSQLQuery(sql); query.addScalar("name", StringType.INSTANCE); query.addScalar("sex", StringType.INSTANCE); query.list();

units.rawText: String sql = "select name, sex from t_student"; SQLQuery query = session.createSQLQuery(sql); queryaddScalar("name", StringType.INSTANCE); queryaddScalar("sex", StringType.INSTANCE); querylist();

node.contents: It should be usefull, but i'm so lazy, i was thought it can be transformed automatically.

node.contents: Very nice and clean solution! Thanks man!

astNode.text: Very nice and clean solution! Thanks man!

node.contents: you can go further and add .setResultTransformer(Transformers.aliasToBean(YOUR_DTO.class)); and automaticly map it to your custom dto object :)

astNode.text: you can go further and add .setResultTransformer(Transformers.aliasToBean(YOUR_DTO.class)); and automaticly map it to your custom dto object :)

elements.contents: public List<MessageExtDto> getMessagesForProfile2(Long userProfileId) { Query query = getSession().createSQLQuery(" " + " select a.*, b.* " + " from messageVO AS a " + " INNER JOIN ( SELECT max(id) AS id, count(*) AS count FROM messageVO GROUP BY messageConversation_id) as b ON a.id = b.id " + " where a.id > 0 " + " ") .addScalar("id", new LongType()) .addScalar("message", new StringType()) ......... your mappings .setResultTransformer(Transformers.aliasToBean(MessageExtDto.class)); List<MessageExtDto> list = query.list(); return list; }

fragments.text: AS a " + " INNER JOIN ( SELECT max(id) AS id, count(*) AS count FROM
) as b ON a.id = b.id " + " where a.id > 0 " + " ") .

units.rawText: public List<MessageExtDto> getMessagesForProfile2(Long userProfileId) { Query query = getSession().createSQLQuery(" " + " select a.*, b.* " + " from messageVO AS a " + " INNER JOIN ( SELECT max(id) AS id, count(*) AS count FROM messageVO GROUP BY messageConversation_id) as b ON a.id = b.id " + " where a.id > 0 " + " ") .addScalar("id", new LongType()) .addScalar("message", new StringType()) ......... your mappings .setResultTransformer(Transformers.aliasToBean(MessageExtDto.class)); List<MessageExtDto> list = query.list(); return list; }
